questions.text: On an endoscopic ultrasound the submucosal layer of esophagus appears as
The motility disorder in esophagus seen more commonly in women, with simultaneous repetitive contractions of high amplitude , normal LES tone and degenerating branches of vagus is known as
Regarding esophageal diverticula, the false statement is

options.label: A
options.text: Epiphrenic diverticula are Pulsion diverticula and have a predilection to involve the region around 5 cm distal to the carina

options.label: B
options.text: Most traction diverticula arise within 4-5 cm proximal or distal to the carina

options.label: C
options.text: Epiphrenic diverticula can be premalignant for squamous cell ca of esophagus

options.label: D
options.text: Dohlman’s procedure is the endoscopic management of Zenker’s diverticulum

questions.correct_answer: A. Epiphrenic diverticula are Pulsion diverticula and have a predilection to involve the region around 5 cm distal to the carina

questions.text: The false statement about dysphagia Lusoria is

options.label: A
options.text: Developmental anomaly of arteries causing dysphagia

options.label: B
options.text: Vascular slings need treatment only in case they are symptomatic.

options.label: C
options.text: Aberrant Right SCA forms a complete vascular ring

options.label: D
options.text: Aberrant Right SCA forms Posterior compression of esophagus

questions.correct_answer: C. Aberrant Right SCA forms a complete vascular ring

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Achlasia cardia is not true

options.label: B
options.text: Risk for malignancy is more for adenoca as compared to squamous cell ca.

questions.correct_answer: B. Risk for malignancy is more for adenoca as compared to squamous cell ca.

questions.text: A 50 year old patient complains of haematemesis after retching and vomiting following a night of binge drinking. options.label: B
options.text: In Sliding hiatal hernia GE junction moves proximally

options.label: C
options.text: Cameron ulcer is associated with sliding hiatal hernia

questions.correct_answer: C. Cameron ulcer is associated with sliding hiatal hernia

questions.text: All of the following statements about Zenker’s diverticulum are true except:

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral X-rays on barium swallow are often diagnostic

options.label: D
options.text: Outpouching of the anterior pharyngeal wall just above the cricopharyngeus muscle

questions.correct_answer: D. Outpouching of the anterior pharyngeal wall just above the cricopharyngeus muscle

questions.text: Dohlman’s procedure is used in:
Which of the following statements about esophageal perforation is true ?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common cause of esophageal perforation is Boerhaave's Syndrome

options.label: B
options.text: Prompt repair of esophageal perforation is done

options.label: C
options.text: Diagnostic test for esophageal perforation is X-ray chest

options.label: D
options.text: Subcutaneous emphysema is not seen in esophageal perforation.

questions.correct_answer: B. Prompt repair of esophageal perforation is done

options.label: B
options.text: On barium it shows as a well demarcated lesion.

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. FNAC is done to diagnose the condition.

options.label: B
options.text: Secondary achalasia is because of chagas disease

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Pseudo achalasia is same as secondary achalasia

questions.text: True about oesophageal pH manometry are all except?

options.label: B
options.text: The pH probe is placed in the upper oesophagus

options.label: C
options.text: The oesophageal pH of < 4 is considered the cut – off

options.label: D
options.text: In a normal individual, a pH <4 is seen in less than 4 % of the 24 hour period

questions.correct_answer: B. The pH probe is placed in the upper oesophagus

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding surgical intervention for esophageal cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: Ivor Lewis esophagectomy involves an upper midline laparotomy and a left thoracotomy.

options.label: B
options.text: Transthoracic esophagectomy (TTE) is associated with a lower total hospital length of stay when compared to a transhiatal esophagectomy (THE).

options.label: C
options.text: There is no difference in mortality between the use of TTE or THE in the surgical treatment of esophageal cancer.

options.label: D
options.text: TTE is associated with fewer complications when compared with THE.

questions.correct_answer: C. There is no difference in mortality between the use of TTE or THE in the surgical treatment of esophageal cancer.

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about Mallory-Weiss syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: The chief pathologic finding is spontaneous perforation of the esophagus.

options.label: B
options.text: It typically occurs on the right side.

options.label: C
options.text: It is usually associated with air in the mediastinum

options.label: D
options.text: Endoscopy should be performed to confirm the diagnosis.

questions.correct_answer: D. Endoscopy should be performed to confirm the diagnosis.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about Zenker diverticulum?

options.label: B
options.text: It is best diagnosed with esophagoscopy.

options.label: C
options.text: It is unlikely to cause aspiration.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a pulsion diverticulum.

questions.text: True about Plummer Vinson syndrome are all except?

options.label: B
options.text: Dysphagia associated with pre – cricoid web

options.label: C
options.text: Webs occur in upper and middle oesophagus

options.label: D
options.text: Webs are easily ruptured at endoscopy

questions.correct_answer: B. Dysphagia associated with pre – cricoid web

questions.text: Most common type of hiatus hernia
Which of the following statements about Barrett's esophagus is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the intestinal metaplasia of esophagus

options.label: B
options.text: Mucus secreting foveolar cells are characteristic

options.label: C
options.text: Alician blue is used in the staining of biopsy specimen

options.label: D
options.text: Adenocarcinoma of O-G junction is a complication

questions.correct_answer: B. Mucus secreting foveolar cells are characteristic

questions.text: What type of achalasia does a 32-year-old male with a diagnosis of achalasia cardia have, based on the findings of high-resolution manometry which showed simultaneous, high-pressure contractions of the distal esophagus?

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Increases risk of squamous cell carcinoma
